channel.title: 2 Corinthians on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in 2 Corinthians on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: 2 Corinthians 1
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 1

1 Paul, apostle of-Christ Jesus by (the) will of-God, and Timothy the brother, to-the church of-[the]-God [the] being in Corinth with all the saints [the] being in all Achaia. 2Grace to-you and peace from God (the) Father of-us and (the) Lord Jesus Christ.

3 Blessed (be) the God and Father of-the Lord of-us Jesus Christ, the Father of-[the] mercies and God of-all comfort, 4the-One comforting us over every [the] trouble of-us unto our being-able to comfort the-ones in every trouble through the comfort that we ourselves are-comforted-with by [the] God. 5Because just-as the sufferings of-[the] Christ abound to us, so through Christ also the comfort of-us abounds. 6And if we-are-afflicted, (it is) on-behalf-of the comfort and salvation of-you. And if we-are-comforted (it is) on-behalf-of the comfort [the] of-you the-one working in endurance of-the same sufferings that we also suffer. 7And the hope of-us (is) firm on-behalf-of you, knowing that as you-are sharers of-the suffering (of us), so also (you are sharers) of-the comfort (of us).

item.title: 2 Corinthians 2
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 2

1 For I-determined this for-myself: [the] not to come to you again in sorrow. 2For if I make┘you└sorrowful, then who (is) the-one cheering ┘me└up except2 the-ones made-sorrowful by me? 3And I-wrote this very-thing in-order-that, having come, I-might┘not└have sorrow from whom it-is-necessary to-make┘me└rejoice, confident in you all that [the] my joy would-be (the joy) of-all of-you. 4For out-of much affliction and anxiety of-heart, I-wrote to-you through many tears, not in-order-that you-might-be-made-sorrowful, but in-order-that you-might-know the love that I-have abundantly for you.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 3
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 3

1 Are-we-beginning to-commend ourselves again? Or do-we-need, as some, recommending letters to you or from you? 2You are the letter of-us, written on the hearts of-us, known and read by all men, 3being-manifested that you-are (a) letter of-Christ, taken-care-of by us, written not with ink, but with-(the)-Spirit of-(the)-living God; not on stone tablets, but on tablets of fleshly hearts.

4 And such confidence we-have through Christ toward [the] God, 5not that we-are sufficient of ourselves to-regard anything as from ourselves, but the sufficiency (is) from [the] God, 6who also made-us sufficient (as) ministers of-(a)-new covenant, not of-(the)-letter, but of-(the)-spirit. For the letter kills, but the spirit enlivens.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 4
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 4

1 On-account-of this, having this [the] ministry even-as we-received-mercy, we-do┘ not└become-discouraged; 2but we-have-renounced the hidden-things of-[the] shame, not walking in trickery or perverting the word of-[the] God, but by-the manifestation of-the truth commending ourselves to every conscience of-men before [the] God. 3And even if the gospel of-us is veiled, it-is veiled in the-ones perishing, 4in whom the god of-this [the] world blinded the minds of-the disbelieving-ones unto [the] the light of-the gospel of-the glory of-[the] Christ, who is (the) image of-God, not enlightening them. 5We do┘not└preach ourselves, but Jesus Christ as Lord, and (ourselves) as your servants on-account-of Jesus, 6because [the] God the-One having-said, “Out-of darkness light will-shine,” (is) who will-shine in the hearts of-us to (the) enlightenment of-the knowledge of-the glory of-[the] God in the face of Jesus Christ.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 5
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 5

1 For we-know that if the earthly house of-us, the tent/tabernacle, is-destroyed, we-have (a) building from God, (a) house not-made-with-hands, eternal in the heavens. 2For in this building we-groan, desiring to-be-dressed-with the building of-us [the] from heaven, 3if indeed also, having-been-dressed, we-will┘not└be-found naked. 4For also we┘the-ones being in the tabernacle/tent└do–groan, being-burdened because we-do┘not└desire to-be-undressed, but to-be-fully-dressed in-order-that the mortal may-be-swallowed-up by [the] life. 5And the-One having-prepared us for this very-thing (is) God, the-One having given us the pledge of-the Spirit.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 6
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 6

1 And working-together (with him), we┘also└urge you not to-have-received the grace of-[the] God in vain. 2For he-says, Behold, now (is the) ‘acceptable time’; now is ‘(the) day of-salvation’; 3giving no cause-of-offence in anything, in-order-that the ministry may┘not└be-found-fault-with, 4but in everything try-to-commend ourselves as minsters, in all endurance, in afflictions, in hardships, in distresses, 5in beatings, in imprisonments, in mob-violences, in labors, in sleeplessnesses, in hungers, 6in purity, in knowledge, in patience, in kindness, in (the/a) holy spirit/Holy Spirit, in love unhypocritical, 7in (the) word of-truth, in (the) power of-God, through the weapons of-[the] righteousness for/in/of-the right (hand) and left (hand), 8through glory and disrespect, through evil-report and good-report, as deceitful and true, 9as known and well-known, as dying and, behold, we-are-alive, as punished and not put-to-death, 10as grieved but always rejoicing, as poor but enriching many, as having nothing and owning all-things.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 7
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 7

1 So having these [the] promises, beloved, let-us-cleanse ourselves from all defilement of-flesh and spirit, perfecting holiness in (the) fear of-God.

2 Make-room-for us; we-wronged nobody; we-corrupted nobody; we-took-advantage-of nobody. 3I-do┘not└speak to (you) condemnation; for I-said-before that you-are in the hearts of-us unto [the] dying-together and living-together. 4Great to-me (is the) confidence/boldness in/toward you; great to-me (is) my boasting on-behalf-of you; I-have-been-filled with-[the] comfort; I-am-overflowing with-[the] joy in all the affliction of us.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 8
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 8

1 Now I-make-known to-you, brothers, the gracious-gift of-[the] God [the] given in the churches of-[the] Macedonia, 2 that in (a) great abundance of-affliction the abundance of-the joy of-them and the according-to death poverty of-them abounded to the wealth of-the liberality of-them, 3I-testify that according-to ability/power, even beyond (their) ability/power (they gave) of-their-own-accord 4with much urging begging┘us└for the favor and the fellowship of-the ministry [the] to the saints, 5and (this) not as we-hoped/expected, but they-gave themselves first to-the Lord and to-us by (the) will of-God 6unto [the] our urging Titus, [in-order]-that as he-made-(an)-earlier-beginning, so also he-would-complete in you this [the] gracious-gift also. 7But as in everything you abound both in word and knowledge and all diligence and the love from us in you [in-order]-that also in this [the] gracious-gift you-might-abound.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 9
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 9

1 For about the ministry [the] to the saints it-is unnecessary for-me to-write to-you. 2For I-know the commitment/eagerness/willingness of-you which I-boast to-(the)-Macedonia about you, that Achaia has-been-prepared from (a) year-ago and the zeal of-you aroused/stirred-up the very-many (of then). 3But I-sent the brothers, in-order-that the boasting of-us [the] about you would┘note└be-empty in this matter, in-order-that, as I-was-saying, you may be prepared/ready, 4lest somehow if Macedonia come with me and find you not-ready/unprepared, we would-be-embarrassed/ashamed, (in-order-that I-may┘not└say) by thie [the] confidence. 5So I-considered (it) necessary to-urge the brothers in-order-that they-would-go-on-ahead to you and prepare-in-advance-of-time the previously-promised blessing of-you, this to-be ready thus as (a) blessing and not as something-pressured-to-be done.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 10
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 10

1 Now I, Paul myself urge you by/through the meekness and gentleness of-[the] Christ, who according-to face (was) meek among you, but bold toward you, being-absent, 2I-ask (that) [the] not, being-present, to be-bold with-the confidence by-which I-reckon to-be-brave against some the-ones reckoning us as walking according-to (the) flesh. 3For walking in (the) flesh, we-do┘not└do-war/battle according-to (the) flesh. 4For the weapons of-the warfare of-us (are) not fleshly, but powerful before/to-[the] God unto (the) destruction of-strongholds/fortresses destroying speculations 5and every stronghold/fortress raised-up against the knowledge of-[the] God and taking┘every thought└captive to the obedience of [the] Christ, 6and having in readiness to-punish every disobedience, when the obedience of-you is-fulfilled/complete.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 11
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 11

1 Oh-that you-would-bear-with me with-respect-to-some little foolishness; and indeed, do-bear-with me. 2For I-am-jealous-for you with-(a)-jealousy of-God, for I-joined┘you└in-marriage to-one husband to-present (you as a) pure virgin. 3But I-am-afraid lest somehow, as the snake deceived Eve with the treachery/craftiness of-him, the minds of-you should-be-led-astray from the simplicity [and [the] purity]ms [the] unto [the] Christ. 4For if the-one coming preaches another Jesus whom we-did┘not└preach, or you-receive (a) different spirit that you-did┘not└receive, or (a) different gospel that you-did┘not└receive, you-give-patient-attention-to (him). 5For I-reckon-myself with-respect-to-nothing to-be-inferior to-the outstanding apostles. 6But even if I-am unskilled in-[the] speech, [but] (I am) not in-[the] knowledge, but in every-way having-made┘(this)└manifest to-you in all-things.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 12
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 12

1 To-boast/boasting is necessary/appropriate, not profitable, but I-will-go to visions and revelations of-(the)-Lord. 2I-know (a) man in Christ before fourteen years, whether in (the) body I-do┘not└know, whether out-of the body I-do┘not└know; [the] God knows, [the] such having-been-caught to (the) third heaven. 3And I-know [the] such (a) man—whether in (the) body, whether outside the body I-do┘not└know; [the] God knows—4that he-was-caught-up to [the] Paradise and heard inexpressible words/things, not permitted/possible for-(a)-man to speak. 5On-behalf-of [the] such-(a man) I-will-boast, but on-behalf-of myself I-will┘not└boast except in [the]/(my) weaknesses. 6For if I-desire to-boast, I-will┘not└ be-foolish, for I-will-speak (the) truth. And I-refrain lest anybody will-count me above what he-sees me (to be) or hears [anything]ms from me 7and by the surpassing greatness of-the revelations. Wherefore, in-order-that I-might┘not└overly-exalt-myself, (a) thorn in-the-flesh was-given to-me, (a) messenger of-Satan, in-order-that it-might-beat me in-order-that I-might┘not└overly exalt myself. 8About this I-appealed-to the Lord three times in-order-that it-might-depart from me. 9And he-has-said to-me, “The grace of-me is-sufficient for-you, for [the] power [of-me]ms is-made-complete/reaches-its-highest-level in weakness.” So, most-gladly I-will-boast instead in the weaknesses of-me, in-order-that the power of-[the] Christ might-live-in/might-rest-on me. 10Wherefore, I-am-content/delight with/in weaknesses, in mistreatments, in necessities, in persecutions and difficulties on-behalf-of Christ. For when I-am-weak, then I-am strong.

item.title: 2 Corinthians 13
item.description:
2 Corinthians Chapter 13

1 This (is the) third (time) I-am-coming to you.

2 I-have-said-before and I-say-in advance as-if being-present the second (time) and being-absent now, to-the-ones having-sinned-previously and to all the others, that if I-come [into the] again, I-will┘not└refrain/spare, 3since you-are-looking-for proof of-[the] Christ speaking in me, who is┘not└weak toward you, but is-strong in you. 4For indeed he-was-crucified out-of weakness, but he-lives by (the) power of-God. For we also are-weak in him, but we-will-live with him by (the) power of-God (directed) at you.
